Sentence.sentence: Since there were few museums anywhere in Europe before the close of the eighteenth century, Grand Tourists often saw paintings and sculptures by gaining admission to private collections, and many were eager to acquire examples of Greco-Roman and Italian art for their own collections.

Sentence.sentence: Europe hardly had any museums before the 19th century.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Beginning in the late sixteenth century, it became fashionable for young aristocrats to visit Paris, Venice, Florence, and above all, Rome, as the culmination ( ' , 终极) of their classical education.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Within just the past five years, I have noticed parents returning to a belief that teenagers need the guidance of elders rather than the liberal, anything goes mode of child-rearing that became popular in the second half of the 20th century.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: For almost five centuries a very large supply of cod ( ' ,  鳕 鱼) provided abundant raw material for an industry which at its peak employed about 40,000 people, sustaining entire communities in Newfoundland.

Sentence.sentence: Even during the turbulent years of last century, youth rebellion was often exaggerated in the media.

stems_affixes.word_buile: cent百,百分之一+enn年+ial表形容词→百年纪念[的]

stems_affixes.value_cn: 百岁或逾百岁以上的[人]
stems_affixes.word_buile: cent百,百分之一+en=enn年+arian人→百岁的人
cent百,百分之一→n.[货币单位]分, 分币;百
cent百,百分之一+enn年+ial表形容词→百年纪念[的]
cent百,百分之一+ury→n.世纪,[一]百年
per每+cent百,百分之一→每一百→百分之
ac加强,一再+cent唱→着重唱→重音
in进入+cent唱+ive→把[力量]唱进去→激励
accent[[n.口音;重音]]匾?uate=ate表动词→强调

sentences.en: The 5th century saw the end of the Roman Empire in the West.
sentences.cn: 古罗马帝国灭亡于五世纪。

sentences.en: The building is some centuries old.
sentences.cn: 这座建筑已建有几个世纪了。

sentences.en: He scored the most fantastic century I have ever witnessed.
sentences.cn: 他所获得的100分是我所见过最好的。</seg>

entry.def: A century is a period of a hundred years that is used when stating a date. For example, the 19th century was the period from 1801 to 1900.

example.ex: ...celebrated figures of the late eighteenth century.

entry.def: A century is any period of a hundred years.

example.ex: The drought there is the worst in a century.
example.tran: 这是一百年来最严重的旱灾。

entry.def: In cricket, a century is a score of one hundred runs or more by one batsman.
entry.tran: (板球中一名击球手获得的)一百分，一百多分

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 3): from Latin centuria, from centum 'hundred'. Sense 1 dates from the early 17th cent

means: Humanist Century (tabloid) <人本主义世纪>（小报）
